conclusion: Introduction to finding work done by gas from state B to state C
Pressure remains constant at 2 × 10³ Pa while volume increases from 2 × 10⁻³ m³ to 3 × 10⁻³ m³
Process from B to C is an isobaric process
Recall formula for work in an isobaric process: W = p · (V_f - V_i)
Pressure p = 2 × 10³ Pa, Initial volume V_i = 2 × 10⁻³ m³, Final volume V_f = 3 × 10⁻³ m³
Calculate work done: W = 2 × 10³ Pa × (3 × 10⁻³ m³ - 2 × 10⁻³ m³) = 2 J
Final answer: Work done externally by gas from B to C is 2 joules
Positive sign of work indicates gas does work on surroundings
